page.title: 01Gretna History
page.content: {Gretna's}fame is of recent origin.Romans and Norsemen settled in the district,followed by the Angles or English giving {Gretna}its name.It was called {Gretenhow}.This means the gravel hill.The River Sark became the boundary between {Scotland}and{England in the reign of Charles 1.In 1376 { {Gretna}was completely destroyed in a battle between the {Scots}and the{ {English. } Robert Burns,the{Scottish}poet, at the time an Excise officer,was frequently detailed to supervise the unloading of the brigs at {Gretna.Then {he }wrote "{The Diels Awa With The {Exciseman}". {Gretna Green}came into prominence in connection with runaway marriage in 1754 when a bill was introduced into {Parliament}to put an end to secret marriage in {England.
